page.title: 01FOREST, ROADS, SCHOOL, PUB
page.content: Our D-Block is mostly forest, much of it owned by{Lord Cowdray}and belonging to the{Paddockhurst Estate. The London {to Brighton}railway runs though the W. side of the block, with the entrance to the{Balcombe tunnel}to the south. The{M 23}cuts across the north west corner. There are 3roads, the{Balcombe {Rd.}going from Pound Hill, Crawley to Balcombe. Off to the west is the{High {Street}which goes to Handcross,and to the east{Paddockhurst Rd}which goes past{Worth School}to Turners Hill. There is also a private school called {Worth School}with land that is let out to a farmer. On the corner of the Balcombe Rd and the Paddockhurst Rd is a pub, the{Cowdray Arms.}In the N.W, corner is part of{Tilgate Park}with a corner of the lake.There are a number of cottages in the district some quite old.There is some farming land also.
